channel.title: Need a program written
channel.description:
in b4 do it yourself
I really need a program written, (it's not homework or anything) and I thought someone who is learning how to program might be interested in it as a project. I'm working on figuring it out myself but it will take a lot longer.
It's one of the tests I need to pass for pilot training, and it's the only test I failed.
It's a basic memory game. 9 buttons 3x3. They light up in a sequence of 15 numbers, and the user copies the sequence.
At level 1, the user presses the button as soon as it lights up. At level 2 they leave a 1 button gap, and so on.
eg at level 3
2 7 5 (press 2) 9 (press 7) 4 (press 5) etc
User imputs the level and the speed.
This is important enough to me that I will write it if I need to, but I figured it was worth a shot to save myself hours on something that should only take minutes.
I'm not exactly counting on anyone doing it due to the nature of the forum, but it would be much appreciated.

Enjoy.

It look shitty as hell, but I should do its work.
The number saying 1 should change to new level numbers.

http://rapidshare.com/files/411290745/3x3.swf

It have no level limit (Too lazy)

If any bugs, please tell and I can fix it before traveling to dreamland.

item.title: Need a program written
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Any language is fine, I just need the program.

It’s similar to that game, but instead of waiting for the sequence to finish you copy it in real time. So at level 1, you click the buttons as soon as they light up, which is easy.

With level 2 and upward, the user must leave a delay that increases with every level.

So at level 1 it might be

3 lights up, (press 3) 7 lights up, (press 7)

then at level 2

3 lights up, 7 lights up, (press 3) 4 lights up, (press 7)

then at level 3

3 lights up, 7 lights up, 4 lights up (press 3) 1 lights up, (press 7)

Read full topic

item.title: Need a program written
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

This looks very easy if Actionscript 3.0 and flash is OK for you.
Ok, understand it, will try my best to make it, but can’t promise anything.

Read full topic
